snippet: Citigroup, Bank of America and Wells Fargo each moved up a notch in the annual risk rankings of banks deemed to be globally important....
abstract: Financial Stability Board, Switzerland-based group that assesses global financial risks, moves Citigroup, Bank of America, Wells Fargo and Industrial and Commerce Bank of China up on their latest ranking of so-called global systemically important banks; move means banks now pose greater risk to global financial system, and subjects them to additional capital requirements; organization also deems Barclays, HSBC and Morgan Stanley as less risky.
lead_paragraph: Citigroup, Bank of America and Wells Fargo each moved up a notch in the annual risk rankings of banks deemed to be globally important.

headline.main: Three Big American Banks Pose Greater Systemic Risk, Regulator Says
headline.print_headline: Global Regulator Says 3 U.S. Banks Pose Greater Risk

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Industrial and Commercial Bank of China
